page.title: 02VALE OF CLWYD-SHEEP FARMING.
page.content: Because the land is fertile a high no. of sheep per acre can be grazed. The original domestic breed is the white {Welsh mountain sheep,}but cross-breeding is common. Border Leics, ram x Welsh ewe = 1/2 breed. The market for Welsh 1/2 breds is Ruthin.{Blue Leicester ram}x {speckle-faced Welsh ewe}= Welsh mule. Mules are then crossed with a{Down ram to give larger leaner carcases for the meat trade. The seasons, & Government subsidies cause price variations.{Nov. {85. Fat lambs 152p-156p per kilo. {Breeding ewes Â£30. Mule breeding {ewes Â£60.}Supplementary feeding is usual, most farmers are self-sufficieut, producing{silage}for ewes & rape for lambs.{Wool}provides 5% income from sheep, & is sold to the Wool Marketing Board.{ {
